artist: Artist: Utagawa Kuniyoshi; Publisher: Ibaya Senzaburō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Written on edge: [97] (97th piece of the series); in yellow rectangular: {Musume Hitomaru}; in red rectangular: {Hyūga ?ō}

Sadaie\'s poem:

(Waiting for a lover who does not come
At the Matsuho beach
Is like a burning salt 
By the evening calm ocean
Keep smoking but never burnt out)

{Ko nu hito wo
Matsuho no ura ni
Yūnagi ni
Yaku ya moshio no
Mi mo kogare tsutsu}


Summary of the Kabuki story written in the purple rectangular calligraphed by Ryūkatei Shuin
*The kabuki story is about a father and his daughter missing each other, which is imitated to the woman missing her lover in the original poem.

{Chichi wa Shimane no menashi dori, ko wa miyako ni kago no tori, chō ga nasake to Saji daiyū ga makoto wo tsue ni Ogasa ni to, en\'en kudaru Hyūga gata, Isobe ni ama ga taku moshio no tsur ??? oya ni ai???
Ryūkaten Shuin hikki}
markings: Red artist\'s seal; Censor: Muramatsu, Yoshimura; publisher\'s seal: {Iba-sen}; carver\'s seal: {Takejirō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Ogura Imitation of One Hundred Poets by One Hundred Poets (Ogura nazorae hyakunin isshu)
title: Gonchūnagon Sadaie
